intro: Nelsonia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy Nelsonia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive hairy foliage and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and is often found in the lower parts of the forest understory. Nelsonia hirsuta is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
